key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA prices for Aer Lingus exhibited consistent pricing strategies, with 90% of short haul offers remaining unchanged.
The MSE channel demonstrated a strong competitive position, offering lower prices 74.96% of the time compared to the airline's website.
GDS fares were predominantly higher, with 98.25% being priced above those on the airline's website.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA prices for Aer Lingus showed little volatility, with the majority of offers remaining stable week-over-week.
In the short haul category, 90% of offers remained the same, indicating a strong consistency in pricing strategy.
Long haul routes experienced a notable increase in higher OTA pricing status, climbing to 16.13% compared to the previous week.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: On average, 9.9% of fares were priced higher on OTAs than on the airline's website.
Approximately 88.8% of offers matched the airline's website, aligning closely with previous periods.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Overall, 90% of pricing was consistent across regions, varying slightly by haul type.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Pricing stability was notable in Ireland with 96.99% same status, contrasting with 82.53% for Non-Ireland routes.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For far-out bookings, 86.31% remained unchanged, promoting strong fare predictability.

mse_highlights.line_content: The MSE channel consistently offered lower prices across 74.96% of last-week comparisons.
Average prices remained unchanged in the SAME status for both last week and the previous week.
In the last month, MSE prices were lower 82.97% of the time.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Pricing remained the same across the MSE channel 24.43% of the time last week.
MSE channel prices were higher only 0.61% of the time in the latest week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul destinations had lower prices offered 74.18% of the time.
Long haul flights consistently remain cheaper 80.77% compared to the airline's website.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For routes originating from Ireland, the MSE channel offered lower prices 74.69% of the time.
On non-Irish routes, lower pricing was observed 75.17% of the time.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in bookings, the MSE channel provided lower prices 77.78% of the time.
Far-out bookings exhibited lower prices 69.37% of the time.

gds_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, 98.25% of fares offered on the GDS channel were higher than those on the airline's website.
The proportion of fares remaining the same across the GDS and the airline's website increased marginally.
Close-in bookings show 98.07% of GDS fares are higher.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 98.25% of total GDS listings were priced higher than the airline's website.
Only 0.08% of fares across the GDS were the same as those on the airline's site.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: For short haul, 99.48% of fares were higher in GDS.
Long haul fares on GDS were 90.38% higher than the airline's website.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In the Irish market, 98.94% of fares on GDS were higher than website prices.
For non-Irish origins, 97.86% of GDS fares were also priced higher.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in booking fares show 98.07% higher prices via GDS.
Far out bookings displayed 99.07% higher GDS fares.
